program main
    implicit none
    character(len=:), allocatable :: input_str
    read(*,'(A)') input_str

    ! First part processing

Process a_str (left to right)
    integer :: i
    do i = 2, len(a_str)
        if (a_str(i:i) == a_str(i-1:i-1)) then
            if (a_str(i:i) == '1') then
                a_str(i:i) = '0'
            else
                a_str(i: i) = '1'
            end if
            a1 = a1 +1
        end if
    end do

    ! Process b_str (right to left)
    do i = len(b_str), 2, -1 if (b_str(i:i) == b_str(i-1:i-1)) then
            if (b_str(i-1:i-1) == '1') then
                b_str(i-1:i-1) = '0'
            else
                b_str(i-1:i-1) = '1'
            end if
            a2 = a2 +1
        end if
    end do

    integer :: N = min(a1, a2)

    ! Second part processing
    integer :: current_i = 357
    integer :: count =0

    do while (current_i <= N)
        ! Check if current_i has 3,5,7
        character(len=20) :: s
        write(s, '(I0)') current_i

            case ('3')
                has3 = .true.
            case ('5')
                has5 = .true.
            case ('7')
                has7 = .true.
            end select
        end do
        if (has3 .and. has5 .and. has7) then
            count = count +1
        end if

        ! Generate next_i
        current_i = next_i(current_i)
    end do

    print*, count

Function next_i(current_i) result(next_i_val)

   integer, intent(in) :: current_i
   integer :: next_i_val
   character(len=20) :: s, new_s
   integer :: len_s, i_char, j, f
   character(len=1) :: c

   write(s, '(I0)') current_i
   len_s = len_trim(s)
   new_s = ''
   f = 0  ! 0 means false, 1 means true
   do j = 1, len_s
       ! process the j-th character from the end of s (i.e., s(len_s - j +1))
       i_char = len_s - j +1
       c = s(i_char:i_char)
       if (f == 0) then
           if (c == '3') then
               new_s = trim(new_s) // '5'
               f = 1
           else if (c == '5') then
               new_s = trim(new_s) // '7'
               f = 1
           else  ! c is '7' or other (but should only be 3,5,7)
               new_s = trim(new_s) // '3'
           end if
       else
           new_s = trim(new_s) // c
       end if
   end do

   ! After processing all characters, check if f is still 0 (false)
   if (f == 0) then
       new_s = trim(new_s) // '3'
   end if

   ! Now reverse the new_s to get the next number
   character(len=len_trim(new_s)) :: reversed_s
   reversed_s = ''
   do i = len_trim(new_s), 1, -1
       reversed_s = reversed_s // new_s(i:i)
   end do

   read(reversed_s, *) next_i_val
end function next_i

The entire Fortran program would be:

program main
    implicit none
    character(len=:), allocatable :: input_str
    read(*,'(A)') input_str

    ! First part processing
    integer :: a1 = 0, a2 = 0
    character(len=len(input_str)) :: a_str, b_str
    a_str = input_str
    b_str = input_str

    ! Process a_str (left to right)
    integer :: i
    do i = 2, len(a_str)
        if (a_str(i:i) == a_str(i-1:i-1)) then
            if (a_str(i:i) == '1') then
                a_str(i:i) = '0'
            else
                a_str(i:i) = '1'
            end if
            a1 = a1 +1
        end if
    end do

    ! Process b_str (right to left)
    do i = len(b_str), 2, -1
        if (b_str(i:i) == b_str(i-1:i-1)) then
            if (b_str(i-1:i-1) == '1') then
                b_str(i-1:i-1) = '0'
            else
                b_str(i-1:i-1) = '1'
            end if
            a2 = a2 +1
        end if
    end do

    integer :: N = min(a1, a2)

    ! Second part processing
    integer :: current_i = 357
    integer :: count =0

    do while (current_i <= N)
        ! Check if current_i has 3,5,7
        character(len=20) :: s
        write(s, '(I0)') current_i
        logical :: has3 = .false., has5 = .false., has7 = .false.
        integer :: j
        do j = 1, len_trim(s)
            select case (s(j:j))
            case ('3')
                has3 = .true.
            case ('5')
                has5 = .true.
            case ('7')
                has7 = .true.
            end select
        end do
        if (has3 .and. has5 .and. has7) then
            count = count +1
        end if

        ! Generate next_i
        current_i = next_i(current_i)
    end do

    print*, count

contains

    integer function next_i(current_i)
        integer, intent(in) :: current_i
        character(len=20) :: s, temp_str, new_str
        integer :: len_s, i, f = 0, j
        write(s, '(I0)') current_i
        len_s = len_trim(s)
        temp_str = ''
        f = 0

        do j = 1, len_s
            i = len_s - j +1
            character(len=1) :: c = s(i:i)
            if (f == 0) then
                if (c == '3') then
                    temp_str = trim(temp_str) // '5'
                    f = 1
                else if (c == '5') then
                    temp_str = trim(temp_str) // '7'
                    f = 1
                else
                    temp_str = trim(temp_str) // '3'
                end if
            else
                temp_str = trim(temp_str) // c
            end if
        end do

        if (f == 0) then
            temp_str = trim(temp_str) // '3'
        end if

        ! Reverse temp_str to get new_str
        new_str = ''
        do i = len_trim(temp_str), 1, -1
            new_str = new_str // temp_str(i:i)
        end do

        read(new_str, *) next_i
    end function next_i

end program main
